response:
A young woman with multifocal CNS involvement (optic nerve, cerebellum, and spinal cord) and no systemic infectious signs strongly suggests a relapsing inflammatory demyelinating disorder, with multiple sclerosis most likely; antibody-mediated demyelinating diseases and systemic autoimmune or metabolic myelopathies are important mimics to exclude.

differential_diagnosis = ["Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis", "Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody-associated disease (MOGAD)", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder", "Central nervous system vasculitis (including systemic lupus erythematosus-related)", "Vitamin B12 deficiency with subacute combined degeneration and optic neuropathy", "Sarcoidosis involving optic nerve, brainstem, and spinal cord"]
